感.definition: to feel; to move; to touch; to affect; feeling; emotion; (suffix) sense of ~

感冒.definition: to catch cold; (common) cold; CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]; (coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative); (Tw) to detest; can't stand

感到.definition: to feel; to sense; to perceive

感動.definition: to move (sb); to touch (sb emotionally); moving

感化.definition: corrective influence; to reform (a criminal); redemption (of a sinner); to influence (a malefactor to a better life); to guide sb back to the right path by repeated word and example

感受.definition: to sense; perception; to feel (through the senses); to experience; a feeling; an impression; an experience

感召.definition: to move and appeal; to rally to a cause; to impel; to inspire

感同身受.definition: to feel as if it had happened to oneself; to sympathize; (polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor

感奮.definition: moved and inspired; fired with enthusiasm

感念.definition: to recall fondly; to remember with emotion

感性.definition: perception; perceptual; sensibility; sensitive; emotional; sentimental

感性工學.definition: kansei engineering (product design that aims to engender specific subjective responses in the consumer) (orthographic borrowing from Japanese 感性工学 "kansei kougaku")

感恩圖報.definition: grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)

感悟.definition: to come to realize; to appreciate (feelings)

感情.definition: emotion; sentiment; affection; feelings between two persons

感情用事.definition: to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse

感愧.definition: to feel gratitude mixed with shame

感慨.definition: to sigh with sorrow, regret etc; rueful; deeply moved

感應.definition: response; reaction; interaction; irritability (biol.); induction (elec.); inductance

感懷.definition: to recall with emotion; to feel sentiments

感染力.definition: infectiousness (of a disease); appeal; power; impact (of an image, marketing message, performance etc)

感染率.definition: rate of infection (usu. of a disease)

感激.definition: to be grateful; to appreciate; thankful

感激涕零.definition: to shed tears of gratitude (idiom); moved to tears

感知.definition: perception (the process of perceiving sth with the senses); to sense; to feel; to detect; to be aware of

感覺.definition: feeling; impression; sensation; to feel; to perceive

感覺到.definition: to feel; to sense; to detect; to perceive; to become aware

感觸.definition: one's thoughts and feelings; emotional stirring; moved; touched

感遇.definition: gratitude for good treatment; to sigh; to lament
